Description of incident: "At Rutgers University, academic information for 1,700 students was exposed during a “data security” incident on November 8 and November 9, reports Tap into Plainfield.University spokesman Neal Buccino says the affected students were in the Department of Computer Science and shared information included ID numbers, cumulative GPAs and class schedules. No Social Security numbers, addresses or financial information were leaked, according to Buccino.The leak, blamed on an “administrative error”, was discovered when 18 students were able to access the data. The school notified the students who were able to view the information that the data was confidential."
